unnormalised: IIT Delhi saw a record number of applications this yr, with a whopping 2.5 lakh students vying for just, like, a handful of seats. Talk about pressure! Sources say the cutoff for CSE will probably be somewhere in the "are you even human?" range, maybe a percentile of 99.99999%. Good luck trying to get in, seriously.
normalised: I-I-T Delhi saw a record number of applications this year, with a whopping two point five lakh students vying for just, like, a handful of seats. Talk about pressure! Sources say the cutoff for C-S-E will probably be somewhere in the "are you even human?" range, maybe a percentile of ninety nine point nine thousand nine hundred and ninety nine percent. Good luck trying to get in, seriously.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, at DU, things are predictably chaotic. Apparently, someone forgot to tell the admission portal that it's supposed to, you know, *work*. Students have been tweeting all sorts of hilarious screenshots of error messages. Someone even photoshopped the error message onto a poster for 'Housefull 5', which, honestly, is an accurate representation of the situation. Last heard, they were "working tirelessly" to fix it. Which probably means restarting the server and hoping for the best.
normalised: Meanwhile, at D-U, things are predictably chaotic. Apparently, someone forgot to tell the admission portal that it's supposed to, you know, work. Students have been tweeting all sorts of hilarious screenshots of error messages. Someone even photoshopped the error message onto a poster for 'Housefull five', which, honestly, is an accurate representation of the situation. Last heard, they were "working tirelessly" to fix it. Which probably means restarting the server and hoping for the best.

unnormalised: On the flip side, some smaller colleges are practically begging for students. One college in Bihar is apparently offering a "free chai and samosa" combo with every application form. It's like they're trying to bribe you into getting an education! Not that I'm complaining about free snacks.
normalised: On the flip side, some smaller colleges are practically begging for students. One college in Bihar is apparently offering a "free chai and samosa" combo with every application form. It's like they're trying to bribe you into getting an education! Not that I'm complaining about free snacks.

unnormalised: Rumor has it that the Education Ministry is considering introducing a new "National Eligibility Test for Netflix Binging". Apparently, watching all seasons of 'Money Heist' in one sitting is now considered a valuable skill. Just kidding! (Unless...?)
normalised: Rumor has it that the Education Ministry is considering introducing a new "National Eligibility Test for Netflix Binging". Apparently, watching all seasons of 'Money Heist' in one sitting is now considered a valuable skill. Just kidding! (Unless...?)

unnormalised: Anyway, good luck to all the students applying for higher education. Remember, even if you don't get into your dream college, there's always the option of becoming a chaiwala. They make more money than some engineers, anyway! (No offense, engineers.)
